Short Description: Work with a classmate for 30 minutes.
Complete your first quest.
Get an introductory letter signed by your parents.
Agree to the website and Acceptable Use policies.
Play 3 games (10 minutes each) on 3 different platforms and write a short reflection about the experience.
Play 3 games (10 minutes each) in 3 different genres. Write a short reflection.
Write a game design document for the game you’ll build as you review. Start simple.
Quest Prerequisites: Back on the Platform, Still Not Genre Fiction

Quest Title: Over and Over and Over and Over
Short Description: Write a script that performs a repeated action 100 times.
Write a script that includes a call to a custom function outside of the main thread.
Write a script that performs an action when a key is pressed.
Write a script that accesses a property of a component to change its value.
Write a script that increases the brightness of a light by 1 unit per second. (Use tutorial video)
Write a script that performs an action every 5 seconds.
Create a new terrain object and create a height map that includes hills, plateaus, mountains and sunken areas.
Create a cube, sphere, cylinder, capsule and empty object.
Create a simple object from primitives and connect it using parent/child relationships.
Create a prefab from your simple object and make 5 instances of it.
Import the character controller object from Unity’s built-in assets and instantiate it.
Find or create a player object and apply Unity’s built-in character controller components to it.
For each type of collider, apply it to an object and take a screenshot.
Explain the difference between colliders and triggers and give one example of when you would use each.
Test Translate() and AddForce() on a rigidbody and static object and describe the difference.
Write a script that adds a force to an object.
Import an asset into your project from the store.
Import a built-in asset package.
Select an appropriate light type for a situation, implement it and explain your decision.
Create a light show.
Research a design topic and write a pitch or short game design document for a game that exemplifies the principle that you read about.
Add a skybox to your game in two ways: render settings and skybox component.
Set fog and ambient light settings to fit your game and explain your choices.
Take a screenshot of the Object view in Blender, including your cube, camera and 3D cursor.
Take a screenshot of your customized UI preferences.
Add a primitive object and alter it in some way.
Save your project and take a screenshot of it in the Finder.
Add a primitive and make it into a dinosaur using extrude and loop cuts.
Topic: Edit Mode, Extrude and Loop Cuts

Short Description: Create a simple model of a cartoon head.
Create a symmetrical object.
Create a multicolored cube.
Create a .png UV map for a cube with six different-colored sides.
Create a snowman out of multiple linked primitives.
Create a humanoid character and rig as described in the video.
Create a player character with a complete rig that fits the Unity format.
Complete the Mecanim character animation tutorial.
Fade a light’s brightness using Lerp().
Create an object after a key press.
Destroy an object with a key press.
Create a script that calls a method after a delay.
Create a custom enumeration.
Create and implement a custom class for inventory management in your game. Make sure the class includes a constructor, as shown in the example.
Create and implement a coroutine.
Create a custom layer and place three objects on it.
Create a custom tag, apply it to an object and use it to send a message to that object from a different object.
Create a physic material test arena with multiple surfaces (ice, rubber, etc) and a character controller. Test the surfaces and describe the properties/differences between them.
Use OnCollisionEnter() function to destroy a cube when another cube falls onto it.
Use a raycast to detect whether there’s anything in front of an object.
Apply a three different cookies to lights and take screenshots. Give one example how you might use each one.
Apply a three different flares to lights and take screenshots. Give one example how you might use each one.
Experiment with the default available shaders and see what they do.
Attach a sound source to an object.
Build a package of assets with a theme and export it. Then test it by importing it into a new project.
Create a quest chain, consisting of at least three quests, that shows players how to complete a task or build a project using Unity or a related application.
Topic: Create a Quest Chain in a Specified Area
